features: AA AAA Batteries Combo Pack: 70% of people choose the 80 knots super zinc-carbon battery, 40 knots AA battery, and 40 knots AAA battery for long-lasting power.
Note Batteries AA and AAA Combo Pack: Only suitable for small appliances with low power consumption, such as remote controls, clocks, scales, meters, and other daily household equipment.
AA AAA Batteries: All carbon batteries are carefully crafted to provide a 3-year shelf life (Note: Disposable batteries are not rechargeable).
ECO-FRIENDLY: Free of mercury, cadmium, and chromium, it is a smart choice for your family and the environment.
After-sales: Any battery problems, Please contact us. PKCELL has been focusing on the R&D and manufacturing of small batteries for 17 years.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars THESE ARE Carbon-Zinc & NOT Alkaline (Duracell etc.) ; OK for gen use; BEST for specialty use
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. These are CARBON ZINC technology batteries and yes they are usually the cheapest and have thd shortest power-on longevity out of almost all consumer grade batteries out of box. Their shelf life is slightly longer and arent as effected by altitude.However, besides being fully non toxic, 100% completely recyclable, safe for the environment (if not fully, then semi-biodegradable compared with alkaline & lithium) much less "leak" prone, MUCH (200%) cheaper to manufacture because their ingredients are ridiculously common on this planet (aluminum shell, steel contacts, zinc, carbon, uneeded plastic brand sleeve) which also allow them to be lighter in physicality. Some folk refer to this physical difference as a sign of "cheapness" which is funny because their correctness depeends entirely on context. Although I DNR of course (even though they won't "explode" or leak "acid), one can squeeze one of these flat bare handed.Without forlnowledge on the pros/cons or of correct application, the main idea is C/Zi batteies work fo special/niche purposes amazingly and not so much otherwise. One generally universal pro is that C/Zi bat. retain all or I'd say at least 75% their strength (As in brightness of a flashlight or beam strength from an IR emmiting LED like those on TV remotes) depending on useage pattern, allowing for B+/A grade & high drain reliability for their short lived life. Compared with standard Duracell or Everready batteries these last maybe 70% to 15% shorter at full output depending on device pwr. specs, temperature and atmospheric pressure (ie. HpA/PSI ) condt.I would either recommend these for low mili-Amp(mA) medium-high voltage devices like remotes, LED flashlights, hand-held AM/FM radios and clocks but on the contrary the opposote is also true. For example, for an RC Vehicle Controller, BT device or Xbox controller, no - BUT - When reliable non dimming high output ampage is required for devices that are prone to data loss or functionality like for say a Nikon Coolpix camera or even an AAA/AA electroshock stun device (of those exist most are 9v. alkaline)In conclusion for batteries I always recommend Panasonic. Their line of Carbon Zinc batteries are superior in longevity and quality.THESE did come remarkably close so they deserve praise.The other comments' negative remarks seem to be from user error or lack of knowledge on available battery technologies, human & battery history, correct batteryt technology type usage.40xAAA & 40xAA are recieved in two boxes; AAs are plasto wrapped in threes & AAA fours. This is a combo pack deal totalling 80 Carbon Zinc batteries.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very happy with these
reviews.reviewText: These batteries are great; I don't see any difference in using an expensive brand over these at all.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good for the price
reviews.reviewText: Decent product for the price although a few of the batteries had dents in them, although they still did actually work.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: These batteries last long id buy them again

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Horrible! They don't last 2 weeks in tv remote!
reviews.reviewText: I'm so upset! I would give zero stars if I could!These batteries didn't last more than 2 weeks in my TV remote! I thought maybe it was just a bad battery, the first time it happened.Then it happened 2 more times after that and knew they were all garbage. I went through all my AA batteries in a matter of a few weeks. This is insane!! Stay far far away!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Know your batteries
reviews.reviewText: I cant believe all the negative comments about how these dont last. For one, what does a person expect from a carbon/acid battery? You cant use these expecting them to last forever. This is an incredible value.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars battery multi pak
reviews.reviewText: They do not have a long life span . I had to change my out door decorations frequently . Excelent price but better off with rayovac or energizer
